data.message: Why don't you use glass bottles

replies.message: Hi Elly, we manufacture glass bottles as part of our range. We understand that it’s hard to like plastic right now but it does play an essential role in providing food and drink that is clean, safe, convenient and fresh. Plastic packaging is much lighter, has lower carbon impact, uses less energy to manufacture than glass and is fully recyclable. As long as it’s responsibly disposed of, it can be recycled and reused into new packaging or other uses such as fibres and fabric. Recycled plastic also uses around two-thirds less energy than virgin plastic, so as recovery rates and technology improve, plastic will become more sustainable.

If your company was responsible and cared for the environment you would not use plastic. Recycling glass bottles is much more environmentally friendly and instead of trying to justify what you do to the planet maybe you should lead by example and make a change
